value.title: How to easily sketch your Power BI reports with your remote team/ customers #StayHome
value.excerpt: As a lot of us are working from home, and more and more meetings are online, how do we gather the requirements from our customers /colleagues for our power bi reports?  In this video I will show you one way to do it with tools you already have in your computer (most likely).   Unfortunately they deleted

value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. Read more about it here: http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  and

value.title: Incremental refresh for free in Power BI
value.excerpt: As you probably are aware, incremental refresh is a premium feature only, but with some DAX magic, you can get incremental refresh for free on Desktop and service!! value.title: List dates between two dates in Power Query
value.excerpt: Need to create a list of dates between a start date and end date? Well, let's look at how Imke did it in the Power BI community, it will blow your mind :) #curbal #powerquery #mlanguage #powerbi  Here is the thread on the Power BI community, where you can find Imke's code: https://community.powerbi.com/t5/Desktop/M-Power-Query-help-for-table-merge-Conditional-Cross-Join/m-p/478272#M222561

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: Pushing the Power BI buttons 👆
value.excerpt: You haven't missed the Power Bi April 2018 update right?  My favourite feature is by far the new buttons! With Power Bi buttons you can create all kinds of experiences, like buttons to change charts, as I show in this demo.  What is your favourite Power BI april 2018 update? Let me know in the comment

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)

Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful
